```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(scales)

# Load the data from TidyTuesday - Weekly US Gas Prices
tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load('2025-07-01')
gas_prices <- tuesdata$gas_prices
```

```{r}
# Create Plot
gas_prices |>
  filter(!is.na(price), !is.na(date)) |>
  mutate(date = as.Date(date)) |>
  filter(fuel == "gasoline", grade == "regular") |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = Date, y = price)) +
  geom_area(fill = "#3498db", alpha = 0.2) + 
  geom_line(color = "#2980b9", linewidth = 1.5) +
  geom_point(color = "#2980b9", size = 1.5, alpha = 0.7) +
  labels(
    title = "US Regular Gasoline Prices Over Time",
    subtitle = "Weekly retail prices showing volatility and trends",
    x = NULL, 
    y = "Price per Gallon (USD)"
  ) +
  theme_minimal(base_family = "Arial") +  
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 18, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 13, color = "grey50"),
    axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
  ) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = dollar_format()) +
  scale_x_date(date_breaks = "2 years", date_labels = "%Y")
```
